title: Attitudes of families to some aspects of Huntington's chorea
abstract: Synopsis One hundred and fifty-three completed questionnaires received from families with a history of Huntington's chorea were analysed to discover their attitudes towards the disease. Of special interest were: ( a ) how and when they were first informed about their illness; ( b ) what effects the knowledge of the hereditary aspects of the disease had on them and on their children; and ( c ) their reaction to a possible future predictive test
